intro: Cirrhopetalum breviscapum, commonly known as the short-capped cirrhopetalum, is a flowering plant native to the Andes mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers with five petals that are often tinged with pink or purple hues. Its leaves are typically ovate and have a rough, hairy texture. Cirrhopetalum breviscapum thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions.
